definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm

sentences.english: The sight was so horrible that Laura changed colour from fear.
sentences.chinese: 這景象如此可怕，勞拉不由大驚失色。

sentences.english: When she discovered her baby had disappeared, she was greatly frantic.
sentences.chinese: 她發現孩子不見了，大驚失色。

sentences.english: Mother paled with shock at the news.
sentences.chinese: 媽媽聽到那消息大驚失色。

sentences.english: Damocles looked up and saw that the sword when alarmed.
sentences.chinese: 達摩克利斯擡頭望見這把利劍時，大驚失色。

sentences.english: They were alarmed to find her dead.
sentences.chinese: 他們發現她死了，大驚失色。

sentences.english: They were alarmed to find the old lady dead.
sentences.chinese: 他們發現老太太死了，大驚失色。

sentences.english: She paled with shock at the news.
sentences.chinese: 她聽到那消息後大驚失色。

definition: lit. dumb as a wooden chicken (idiom); fig. dumbstruck
no way out/nowhere to go/trapped beyond hope of rescue/painted into a corner
to amuse oneself/to play with/to tease
to burst into tears/to sob loudly/to bawl
to lose one's head out of fear (idiom)
